admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
To help the government develop the
            institutional capacity, initially in the Ministries of
            Irrigation and Land Reclamation, to undertake pre-investment
            planning, feasibility and engineering studies and other work
            related to project preparation. In addition to long-term
            institutional support, including necessary materials, the
            project would fund short-term specialists and training
            programs. The project would also help fund special studies
            related to project preparation. The project would help the
            ministries involved to determine investment priorities and
            develop projects, thereby substantially strengthening their
            investment programs and reducing reliance on outside
            assistance. Risks of poor project performance would arise
            primarily from the lack of sufficiently trained counterpart
            staff in project preparation and related delays in
            adequately staffing the project preparation units. The
            project's provision for extensive on-the-job training,
            as well as domestic and overseas training programs would
            address these problems. Risks of delay would be reduced with
            the requirement that, as a condition of effectiveness, a
            project preparation unit (PPU) would be established in the
            Ministry of Land Reclamation; the PPU in the Ministry of
            Irrigation has already been established.
